title: RAG AI Assistant
description:
As part of my work with Ticketflipping, I developed an AI Assistant that uses Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to reply to user's messages using 7 years of Slack messages, 100+ training videos and demo calls, and other internal resources. These total to 250K+ vector objects.

My work was from beginning to end, which includes data treatment, embedding, Langflow process design, designing the agent prompts, creating and managing the Redis instance, deploying Langflow to private EC2 instance, creating and setting up the Slack Bot, and testing the tool.

impact.impact_1: Unlocked access to 7+ years of institutional knowledge for all team members
impact.impact_2: Handles 500+ user queries monthly, reducing support burden on senior team members

title: Ticketmaster Heat Map
description:
My first project with Ticketflipping. I reached out to them after a couple of months of being their customer, and asked if they wanted to have a Ticketmaster Heat Map developed for them, and they said yes. After 2 months of work, I delivered the feature and integrated it into their Chrome Extension.

The main challenge was understanding the data from Ticketmaster, and developing scrapping mechanisms to get the price, section, row, and number of all seats in any venue.

impact.impact_1: Ticketflipping's Chrome Extension now has a Heat Map feature, which is used by 1000+ users monthly
impact.impact_2: Reduces businesses research time by at least 10%

title: Kimani: Virtual Community Platform - Post A Trip Feature
description:
I was hired by Kimani to develop a new feature for their virtual community platform. The feature allows users to post a trip to share where they are going with the rest of the community.

The main challenge was to understand the data model and the business logic of the platform, and to develop a feature that is easy to use and maintain. Also, if you know Rust, not too many words are needed to explain the challenge.

impact.impact_1: Added one of the first interactive features to the platform

title: Implementation of Server Side Caching (Redis)
description:
High loading times were a major issue among Ticketflipping's customers, aand the issue continued to increase thanks to the hike in entertainment events during the last few years. Initially the site was created to use client-side caching for tables with 20K+ rows, but once the event count passed 40K, many customers would wait from 10 to 40 seconds for one of the pages to load.

I was tasked with implementing any solution to the issue. After some research, I found Redis and implemented it in the backend of Ticketflipping's Django app. My work was from beginning to end, which includes setting up the Redis instance, creating the cache logic, coding the backend operations, and designing and constructing the cached tables and advanced filtering. Since then, I have brought 34 of Ticketflipping's views to use Redis caching.

impact.impact_1: Reduced loading time for all pages by 95%

title: Flare: Event Data Platform
description:
Although this does not constitute to a specific project, I have dedicated over 20% of my time with Ticketflipping to work on their entertainment event data platform, Flare. The platform is the heart of Ticketflipping's business, and is used by all their customers to manage events, view their data, set up alerts for ticket count and price, and conducting research. Flare counts with many features, some of which are viewing event historical data, tracking event sales, or managing a portfolio of events. Flare tracks around 100K events in the US, and partial covery of the rest of the world. This includes primary markets (Ticketmaster, AXS, tickets.com) and secondary markets (StubHub, Tickpick, Seatgeek, Viviseats, etc.).

My work in this platform consists on Debugging Issues, developing features, explanding coverage to other markets (Tickets.com and Tickpick), and keeping up with user's requests.

impact.impact_1: Ticketflipping's community received 1-2 major updates per month
impact.impact_2: 15-30 bugs/month are fixed and deployed within an average of 3 days
